title: Fuseli and the Modern Woman: Fashion, Fantasy, Fetishism
excerpt: An exhibition devoted to a remarkable group of around fifty drawings by Henry Fuseli (1741 – 1825), one of 18th-century Europe’s most original and eccentric artists.

title: Helen Saunders
excerpt: The first monographic exhibition devoted to British abstract artist Helen Saunders (1885-1963) in over 25 years. The exhibition showcases a representative group of the artist’s drawings and watercolours to shed light on an artist whose contribution...
imageAlt: A bold drawing in thick black graphite and ink, on a slightly aged paper. At the bottom, linear forms slightly resemble human forms, and they surround a circular post-like form in the centre of the sheet. On the top half, building-like forms sit atop the black background, with sharp lines of black and white dotting the background.

title: Traces: Renaissance Drawings for Flemish Prints
excerpt: Showcasing a selection from The Courtauld’s rich collection of works on paper, this display will explore the world of 16th century Flemish print production.

title: Edvard Munch. Masterpieces from Bergen
excerpt: A major collection of works by Edvard Munch will be shown in the UK for the first time as part of a partnership between The Courtauld and KODE art museums in Bergen, Norway.
price: Weekend tickets from £18, Friends and Under-18s go free

title: Summer School online
excerpt: Open to all. Online. The programme runs throughout June and offers 16 in-depth art history short courses ranging from Renaissance to contemporary art. All courses are led by experts in their field and student numbers are limited to enable proper conv...
imageAlt: A beach with horses, tourists. There are small sailboats in the distance on the sea, and a small town.

title: Unimpressed: Livery Badge and Legal Tender in Late Medieval England
excerpt: At the center of this talk are two unimpressive objects: the livery badge and the coin.
imageAlt: Image of two metal coins overlapping

title: Fashion: Visual & Material Interconnections Book Series ‘Prêt-à-Porter, Paris and Women’ Launch
excerpt: Join us for the launch of the next title in the Fashion: Visual & Material Interconnections Book Series: ‘Prêt-à-Porter, Paris and Women’, by Alexis Romero.

title: Writing to Images: The Practice of Corresponding with Art￼
excerpt: In this keynote lecture, Tina M. Campt will expand upon her practice around writing as writing to, rather than about, images.
imageAlt: Photograph of a black woman facing the camera, leaning on a wall with her elbow, hand on cheek

title: Anachronism and assemblage: the unfinished image of Montreal
imageAlt: A photograph in black and white of people looking up at a building while surrounded by paper.

title: The Art of Experiment: Parmigianino at The Courtauld
excerpt: This display will present an important group of twenty-two works by Parmigianino from The Courtauld’s collection.

title: The Desert in the Lagoon
excerpt: David Young Kim will screen his new film, “The Desert and the Lagoon" (co-directed with Amelia Saul).

title: On the Framing of Women: Art Historical and Theological Perspectives￼
excerpt: Following the recent opening of Reframed: The Woman in the Window at Dulwich Picture Gallery—to great critical acclaim—this seminar will offer an opportunity to hear from its curator, Jennifer Sliwka, about some of the religious traditions of dep...

title: Memento mori  Imagery and the Limits of the Self in Late Medieval Europe
excerpt: Stephen G. Perkinson delivers the annual ICMA lecture on Momento Mori Imagery.

title: Ukrainian Modernism and the Architecture of Standardization
excerpt: Christina E. Crawford provides historical context to situate present-day destruction of architecturally rich Kharkiv, the first capital of the Ukrainian Soviet Socialist Republic (1919-34).

title: The Art Collector in Early Modern Italy: Andrea Odoni and his Venetian Palace
excerpt: Monika Schmitter will present her recent book which investigates who Odoni was and how and why he amassed an impressive collection of antiquities, modern sculpture, paintings, and naturalia in his relatively modest Venetian palace.

title: 2021 - 2022 Postgraduate Symposium
excerpt: You are invited to join The Courtauld's annual Postgraduate Symposium of 2021 - 2022.
imageAlt: A photograph showing an empty statue plinth surrounded by orange construction cones

title: Art History Summer University 2022
excerpt:
Calling all Year 12 students!
Apply now to our free online Art History Summer University and spend five days learning online with The Courtauld, a world-class university specialising in Art History, Conservation, and Curating.

title: Visit the permanent collection
excerpt: You can now book your visit to see our much-loved collection of masterpieces ranging from the Middle Ages to the 20th century.

title: After Hours: To Be Human
Between Power and Conflict: Case studies of art in times of war and revolution from 1868 to today [Online]
excerpt: Summer term of 5 lectures in the Showcasing Art History programme
price: £95 (discounts apply if you book more than 1 term)
imageAlt: An American GI inspects a looted Durer print in the Merkers salt mine complexines.

title: Between Power and Conflict: Case studies of art in times of war and revolution from 1868 to today [On campus]
excerpt: Summer term of 5 lectures in the Showcasing Art History programme
price: £95 (discounts apply if you book more than 1 term)
imageAlt: An American GI inspects a looted Durer print in the Merkers salt mine complexines.

title: Kurdistan in the 1940s
excerpt: This exhibition in the Project Space features 21 compelling photographs from the collection by Anthony Kersting.
